author: M Suganth
title: Radio Petti: the first Tamil film to win at Busan
text:
Debutant director Hari Viswanathan's Radio Petti, a moving drama about a 70-year-old retired man's love affair with his vintage radio box (a gift from his father), has won the KNN Award (Audience Award) at the Busan Film Festival. This is the first Tamil film and second film from India (after Mangesh Hadawale's 2011 film, Watch Indian Circus) to win this prestigious award.
Speaking to Chennai Times from Busan hours before walking the red carpet to collect the award, Hari said, "The award is voted by the audiences who attend the film festival. Eight films were in the race and I'm extremely thrilled that they chose to award my film. I am honoured."
